NLS_STRINGS.ADP_InvalidXMLBadVersion: Invalid Xml; can only parse elements of version one.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_WrongType: Operation on type %1 attempted with target of wrong type.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_NoQuoteChange: The QuotePrefix and QuoteSuffix properties can't be changed once an Insert, Update, or Delete command has been generated.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_MissingSourceCommand: The DataAdapter.SelectCommand property needs to be initialized.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_MissingSourceCommandConnection: The DataAdapter.SelectCommand.Connection property needs to be initialized;
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_CollectionUniqueValue: The %1.%2 is required to be unique, '%3' already exists in the collection.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_CollectionIsNotParent: The %1 with %2 '%3' is already contained by another %4.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_CollectionIsParent: The %1 with %2 '%3' is already contained by this %4.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_CollectionRemoveInvalidObject: Attempted to remove an %1 that is not contained by this %2.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_CollectionIndexInt32: Invalid index %1 for this %2 with Count=%3.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_CollectionIndexString: An %1 with %2 '%3' is not contained by this %4.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_CollectionNullValue: The %1 only accepts non-null %2 type objects.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_CollectionInvalidType: The %1 only accepts non-null %2 type objects, not %3 objects.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_ColumnSchemaExpression: The column mapping from SourceColumn '%1' failed because the DataColumn '%2' is a computed column.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_ColumnSchemaMismatch: Inconvertable type mismatch between SourceColumn '%1' of %2 and the DataColumn '%3' of %4.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_ColumnSchemaMissing1: Missing the DataColumn '%1' for the SourceColumn '%2'.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_ColumnSchemaMissing2: Missing the DataColumn '%1' in the DataTable '%2' for the SourceColumn '%3'.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_InvalidSourceColumn: SourceColumn is required to be a non-empty string.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_MissingTableSchema: Missing the '%1' DataTable for the '%2' SourceTable.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_InvalidSourceTable: SourceTable is required to be a non-empty string
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_InvalidCommandType: The CommandType enumeration value, %1, is invalid.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_InvalidUpdateRowSource: The UpdateRowSource enumeration value, %1, is invalid.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_CommandTextRequired: %1: CommandText property has not been initialized
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_OpenConnectionRequired: %1 requires an open connection. The connection's current state is %2.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_TransactionConnectionMismatch: The transaction object is not associated with the connection object.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_TransactionRequired_Execute: Execute requires the command to have a transaction object when the connection assigned to the command is in a pending local transaction. The Transaction property of the command has not been initialized.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_TransactionCompleted: The transaction assigned to this command must be the most nested pending local transaction.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_OpenReaderExists: There is already an open DataReader associated with this Command which must be closed first.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_DeriveParametersNotSupported: %1 DeriveParameters only supports CommandType.StoredProcedure, not CommandType.%2
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_MissingSelectCommand: The SelectCommand property has not been initialized before calling '%1'.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_FillSchemaRequiresSourceTableName: FillSchema: expected a non-empty string for the SourceTable name.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_InvalidMaxRecords: The MaxRecords value of %1 is invalid; the value must be >= 0.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_InvalidStartRecord: The StartRecord value of %1 is invalid; the value must be >= 0.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_FillRequiresSourceTableName: Fill: expected a non-empty string for the SourceTable name.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_FillChapterAutoIncrement: Hierarchial chapters columns must map to an AutoIncrement DataColumn.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_UpdateRequiresSourceTable: Update unable to find TableMapping['%1'] or DataTable '%1'.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_UpdateRequiresSourceTableName: Update: expected a non-empty SourceTable name.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_UpdateRequiresCommandClone: Update requires the command clone to be valid.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_UpdateRequiresCommandSelect: Auto SQL generation during Update requires a valid SelectCommand.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_UpdateRequiresCommandInsert: Update requires a valid InsertCommand when passed DataRow collection with new rows.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_UpdateRequiresCommandUpdate: Update requires a valid UpdateCommand when passed DataRow collection with modified rows.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_UpdateRequiresCommandDelete: Update requires a valid DeleteCommand when passed DataRow collection with deleted rows.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_UpdateNullRowTable: DataRow does not belong to a DataTable.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_UpdateMismatchRowTable: DataRow[%1] is from a different DataTable than DataRow[0].
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_RowUpdateErrors: %1: Errors occurred; no additional is information available.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_SumOverflow: %1: The sum of %2 and %3 can not exceed %4.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_InvalidCommandTimeout: Invalid CommandTimeout value %1; the value must be >= 0.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_UninitializedParameterSize: Parameter %1: '%2' of type: %3, the property Size has an invalid size: %4
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_PrepareParameterType: %1.Prepare requires all parameters to have an explictly set type.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_PrepareParameterSize: %1.Prepare requires all variable length parameters to have an explictly set non-zero Size.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_PrepareParameterScale: %1.Prepare requires parameters of type '%2' have an explictly set Precision and Scale.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_ClosedConnectionError: Invalid operation. The connection is closed.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_NoConnectionString: The ConnectionString property has not been initialized.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_OpenConnectionPropertySet: Not allowed to change the '%1' property while the connection (state=%2).
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_EmptyDatabaseName: Database cannot be null, the empty string, or string of only whitespace.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_InvalidConnectTimeoutValue: Invalid 'Connect Timeout' value of '%1'. the value must be an integer >= 0.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_InvalidPersistSecurityInfo: Invalid 'Persist Security Info' value of '%1'. The value must be a boolean of 'true' or 'false'.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_PoolFull: Connection Pool has reached the maximum number of connections.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_DataReaderNoData: No data exists for the row/column.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_DataReaderClosed: Invalid attempt to %1 when reader is closed.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_StreamClosed: Invalid attempt to %1 when stream is closed.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_DynamicSQLJoinUnsupported: Dynamic SQL generation is not supported against multiple base tables.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_DynamicSQLNoTableInfo: Dynamic SQL generation is not supported against a SelectCommand that does not return any base table information.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_DynamicSQLNoKeyInfo: Dynamic SQL generation for the %1 is not supported against a SelectCommand that does not return any key column information.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_DynamicSQLReadOnly: Dynamic SQL generation for the %1 is not supported against a SelectCommand that does not return any modifiable columns.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_DynamicSQLNestedQuote: Dynamic SQL generation not supported against table names '%1' that contain the QuotePrefix or QuoteSuffic character '%2'.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_NonSequentialColumnAccess: Invalid attempt to read from column ordinal '%1'. With CommandBehavior.SequentialAccess, you may only read from column ordinal '%2' or greater.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_InvalidDataType: The parameter data type of %1 is invalid.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_UnknownDataType: No mapping exists from DbType %1 to a known %2.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_UnknownDataTypeCode: Unable to handle an unknown TypeCode of %1 with DataType of %1.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_InvalidSizeValue: Invalid parameter Size value '%1'. The value must be greater than or equal to 0.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_WhereClauseUnspecifiedValue: Parameter['%1'] contained within auto gen WHERE clause with SourceColumn '%2' has an unspecified Original value in the DataRow at column '%3'.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_TruncatedBytes: Error: byte array truncation to a length of %1.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_TruncatedString: Error: string truncation: max=%1, len=%2, value='%3'
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_TransactionZombied: This %1 has completed; it is no longer usable.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_Reenlist: Connection currently has transaction enlisted. Finish current transaction and retry.
NLS_STRINGS.DbConnection_InfoMessage: Event triggered when messages arrive from the DataSource.
NLS_STRINGS.DbConnection_StateChange: Event triggered when the connection changes state.
NLS_STRINGS.DbConnection_State: ConnectionState indiciating if the connection is open or closed.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_ConnectionStringTooLong: Connection string exceeds maximum allowed length of %1.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2_UnsupportedCommandTypeTableDirect: The DB2 .NET Data Provider does not support CommandType.TableDirect
NLS_STRINGS.DB2_CantSetPropertyOnOpenConnection: Can't set property on an open connection.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2_CantAllocateEnvironmentHandle: %1 - unable to allocate an environment handle.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2_MissingProperty: %1 requires a value for the property %2.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2CommandBuilder_DataAdapter: The DataAdapter for which to automatically generate DB2Commands
NLS_STRINGS.DB2CommandBuilder_QuotePrefix: The character used in a text command as the opening quote for quoting identifiers that contain special characters.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2CommandBuilder_QuoteSuffix: The character used in a text command as the closing quote for quoting identifiers that contain special characters.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Types_NullValue: The value of the DB2Type is null.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Types_TruncateValue: This value of the DB2Type will be truncated.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Types_DecimalOverflow: Value was either too large or too small for a Decimal.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Types_InvalidFormat: Input string was not in a correct format.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2MetaDataFactory_TooManyRestrictions: More restrictions were provided than the requested schema '%1' supports.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2MetaDataFactory_NullOrPatternRestrict: The value specified for restriction '%2' cannot be null or a pattern for the GetSchema '%1' collection.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ResultSet_CanNotUpdateNewRow: Newly insert rows of a keyset cursor are not updatable.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ResultSet_InvalidResultSetOptions: (%1) is an invalid combination for DB2ResultSetOptions.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ResultSet_UpdatableRecordNotCreatedBy: DB2UpdatableRecord was not created by this instance of DB2ResultSet.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ResultSet_RowsHasBeenDeleted: Invalid operation %1. The row has been deleted.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ResultSet_CursorClosed: Invalid attempt to %1 when cursor is closed.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2_ExclusiveUseOfConnection: %1 requires exclusive access to database connection.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2BulkCopy_MappingConflict: Source column '%1' and '%2' both map the same destination column '%3'.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2BulkCopy_DestinationNotExist: The destination column '%1' in the column mapping does not exist in the destination table.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2BulkCopy_SourceNotExist: The source column '%1' in the column mapping does not exist in the source.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2BulkCopy_LeftOverMapping: Mapping for source column '%1' exists in DB2BulkCopyColumnMappingCollection but does not exist in the source.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2BulkCopy_InvalidSourceColumnType: Source column '%1' is of type '%2' and destination column '%3' is of type '%4'.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2BulkCopy_NumSrcColumnsGtDest: There are more source columns the there are at the destination table.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2BulkCopy_InTransaction: DB2BulkCopy can not operate under transactional control.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2BulkCopy_Aborted: DB2BulkCopy.WriteToServer was interrupted due to application setting DB2RowsCopiedEventArgs.Abort to true.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Command_SelectOnly: %1 supports SELECT and VALUES statements only.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2XmlCommand_InvalidCommandText: %1 is not a valid CommandText for DB2XmlCommand.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2XmlCommand_InvalidRootTag: %1 is not a valid RootTag for DB2XmlCommand.
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_InvalidConnectionOption: The connection option value specified is invalid for %1.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_Database: The name of the database to connect to.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_ServerType: The type of server to which you want to connect (UniData, UniVerse)
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_Server: The server name with optional port number for direct connection. Syntax: server name[:port]
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_ConnectionRes: True - This particular connection will be put into the connection pool when it is closed. False - This particular connection will not be put into the connection pool when it is closed
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_ConnectionLif: The Amount of time (seconds) that the connection can remain idle in the connection pool. Default is 60 seconds.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_Enlist: True - Enlistment to Distributed Transaction Coordinator (DTC) is allowed (this will only enlist if a COM+ transaction is in progress at connect time) False - enlistment to Distributed Transaction Coordinator (DTC) is not allowed
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_PersistSecuri: True - Allow security-sensitive information, such as password, to be returned as part of the connection string after the connection has been opened or if the connection has ever been in an opened state. False - Security-sensitive information is not returned as part of the connection string. False is strongly recommended.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_IsolationLeve: Isolation level for the connection; possible values are: ReadCommitted ReadUncommitted RepeatableRead Serializable This keyword is only supported for applications participating in a distributed transaction, such as a COM+ application. For applications that do not participate in a distributed transaction, this keyword is not supported and an InvalidArgument exception is thrown.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_CLISchema: This keyword indicates that a set of db2ocat tables should be queried to generate the schema function result sets. The string value setting is the schema name of the db2ocat tables. For example, CLISCHEMA=CAT001 uses CAT001 as the schema of the db2ocat tables.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_SysSchema: This keyword indicates that a set of shadow catalog tables should be used instead of the actual system catalog tables. The schemaName value is the schema for the shadow catalog tables.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_DBName: DBNAME is used to restrict the schema function queries based on the database name. This applies only to zOS servers.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_TableType: The TABLETYPE keyword is used to restrict the result sets of the SQLTables stored procedure to a set of table types. Syntax: TABLETYPE="type1,type2,typeN"
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_SchemaList: The SCHEMALIST keyword is used to restrict the result sets of the schema functions to a set of schemas. Syntax: SCHEMALIST ="schema1,schema2,schema3,..."
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_MapDate: The MAPDATE keyword indicates that DATE types should be reported as a different data type. Syntax: MAPDATE = 0 | 1 | 2 (default is 0) 0 - No mapping is performed 1 - Report DATE columns as SQL_CHAR (1) 2 - Report DATE columns as SQL_WCHAR ( -8 )
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_MapTime: The MAPTIME keyword indicates that TIME types should be reported as a different data type. Syntax: MAPTIME = 0 | 1 | 2 (default is 0) 0 - No mapping is performed 1 - Report TIME columns as SQL_CHAR (1) 2 - Report TIME columns as SQL_WCHAR ( -8 )
NLS_STRINGS.DB2ConnectionStringBuilder_MapTimestamp: The MAPTIMESTAMP keyword indicates that TIMESTAMP types should be reported as a different data type. Syntax: MAPTIMESTAMP = 0 | 1 | 2 (default is 0) 0 - No mapping is performed 1 - Report TIMESTAMP columns as SQL_CHAR (1) 2 - Report TIMESTAMP columns as SQL_WCHAR ( -8 )
NLS_STRINGS.ADP_NonSeqByteAccess: Invalid %3 attempt at dataIndex '%1'. With CommandBehavior.SequentialAccess, you may only read from dataIndex '%2' or greater.
NLS_STRINGS.DbCommand_CommandTimeout: Time to wait for command to execute.
NLS_STRINGS.DbCommand_Transaction: The transaction used by the command.
NLS_STRINGS.DbCommand_UpdatedRowSource: When used by a DataAdapter.Update, how command results are applied to the current DataRow.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_ConnectionString: Information used to connect to a Data Source.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_ConnectionTimeout: Current connection timeout value, not settable in the ConnectionString.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_Database: Current data source catalog value, 'Database=X' in the connection string.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_DataSource: Current data source, 'Server=X' in the connection string.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_ServerVersion: Version of the server accessed by the DB2 driver.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_ServerType: Type of the server accessed by the DB2 driver.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2Connection_ConnectionBusyWithUpdateBa: %1: Connection is busy with an Update Batch
NLS_STRINGS.DbDataAdapter_DeleteCommand: Used during Update for deleted rows in DataSet.
NLS_STRINGS.DbDataAdapter_InsertCommand: Used during Update for new rows in DataSet.
NLS_STRINGS.DbDataAdapter_UpdateCommand: Used during Update for modified rows in DataSet.
NLS_STRINGS.DataParameter_IsNullable: Property that indicates whether the parameter is nullable.
NLS_STRINGS.DataParameter_SourceColumn: When used by a DataAdapter.Update, the source column name that is used to find the DataSetColumn name in the ColumnMappings. This is to copy a value between the parameter and a datarow.
NLS_STRINGS.DataParameter_SourceVersion: When used by a DataAdapter.Update (UpdateCommand only), the version of the DataRow value that is used to update the data source.
NLS_STRINGS.DbDataParameter_Size: Size of variable length data types (string & arrays).
NLS_STRINGS.DB2DataAdapter_UpdateNotAllowedWhenChain: DataAdapter.Update not supported when Chaining is on
NLS_STRINGS.DB2_ObjectNotAccessibleFromCurrentRow: The object is not accessible from the current row.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2_NoMoreData: There is no more data to return.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2_CanNotMixStreaming: Can not mix streaming and non-streaming data access methods when data caching is disabled.
